1.content:
So which girl would you like to make gross:

Sophie (Age 20), the penniless student who can't afford to pay the water bill for her apartment?

Kristie and Amy (Age 16), the frenemies who have gotten themselves into a bet over who can go longer without showering?

Jenna (Age 18), who is being blackmailed by her romantic rival into performing an assortment of disgusting tasks?

Candy (Age 22), who is trying her hardest to clean up her filthy pig of a boyfriend, but might just let him drag her down into the muck?

Or maybe another girl in entirely different circumstances?
1.title: Pick your girl!

15.content:
Okay, how about:

Rebecca (Age 14), who broke the rules and is forbidden from showering as a punishment?

Lindsay (Age 17), who is boycotting soap to protest low wages?

Elly (Age 8), who hates baths and has sworn to never take one again?

Juliet (Age 19), who finds herself the target of a life-altering prank?
15.title: Other

choices: “You are hereby banned from entering a bathroom for any reason!”
151.content:
Rebecca was attempting to be as quiet as possible. It was nearing 1 A.M., and she was only just coming home from a party, way past curfew. It wasn’t the first time she had done this. On the contrary, staying out past curfew was becoming a habit for her.

Unfortunately, she didn’t have the best record when it came to “not getting caught”. In fact, she was on her last strike, and her parents had promised a particular nasty punishment if they caught her again.

Despite this, she wasn’t particularly worried. Her parents were full of hot air, they’d never give her that bad of a punishment. Or so she thought.

However, when the lights came on and she saw the stern faces of her mother and father, she knew she was in real trouble. Her mother spoke first.

“Rebecca! This is the last straw, young lady! Night after night, you’ve been gone well after midnight, doing god knows what with your friends! You’ve shrugged off punishment after punishment without changing your ways, so I think it’s time we tried something more unorthodox. Let’s see you stay out with friends when nobody wants to be around you!”
151.title: Rebecca

choices: Rebecca wakes up and has to piss
Rebecca wakes up and has to shit.
Rebecca wakes up and goes to school
1512.content:
“What?”

Rebecca didn’t understand. What did she mean she couldn’t enter a bathroom? Her father spoke up next.

“Exactly what your mother said. All bathrooms are off-limits, until we say otherwise. I’m sure after a week or two of being unable to wash, nobody will want to hang out with you, after curfew or otherwise.”

“What?”

But Rebecca’s punishment was finally sinking in. And it was nastier, both figuratively and literally, than she could have possibly imagined.

“But, but, but what about toilets?! If I can’t go into bathrooms, where am I supposed to... relieve myself?!”

“Not our problem. You should have thought about that before you continuously disobeyed us. I suppose you can go on the floor if you want, just keep it in your room. Speaking of your room, go to bed now. You’ll have a lot to get used to come morning.”

Rebecca was too stunned to reply. Did her father really just suggest she turn her bedroom into her own personal toilet? And what, live in her own waste?

But her feet moved by pure inertia, and before long she found herself asleep on her bed, hoping the night’s events were just a bad dream.
1512.title: “You are hereby banned from entering a bathro...

choices: Lindsay tries to convince her friends to join her boycott
After a few days, Lindsay has developed a noticeable funk about her
152.content:
Lindsay had always cared more than most. Cared about the environment, about the poor, about substandard working conditions. As such, at the young age of 17, she was already a budding social activist, doing whatever she could to protest against injustice in the world.

Which is why she was so troubled as she read the latest article on GoReform, her favorite activism blog. According to said article, the soap industry was in bad shape. The soap they used in the US was imported from a number of third world countries, where workers produced it in hazardous conditions for just pennies a day.

This was an outrage, and Lindsay wouldn’t stand for it! But what could she do to help? Hmm...

Well, soap was important, but it wasn’t really essential, was it? She could simply refuse to support such an abominable industry by refusing to buy or use their products. A boycott! Sure, she might smell a bit ripe after a little bit, but that would just draw attention to her cause.

It was decided. Lindsay simply wouldn’t wash until industry standards improved. But one person might not be enough. Hmmm..
152.title: Lindsay

1553.content:
At an all girls’ high school, a rather peculiar club exists. They call themselves the Skunk Club, and they pride themselves on being as stinky and gross as humanly possible.

But how does such a club even form? What inspired these girls to band together for such an unusual purpose?

Was it a protest against an unpopular school rule? Or maybe a bond of solidarity between girls who were picked on because of odor problems? Or another reason entirely?
1553.title: The Skunk Club

choices: Vane the fat smelly  orc chief
15533.content:
Lorraine age 13
A fat elf princess who has taken over the throne when her father the king abdicated.
She has made a royal edict, that all women in her kingdom are forbidden from cleansing themselves.

Vane age 30
A fat smelly orc chief. Who has taken over a human village.
15533.title: More girls

info.brief_description: Take normal girls and strip them of their hygiene until they become completely disgusting.
info.description:
Girls are about to have their cleanliness stripped from them through circumstances that may or may not be within their control. As for how they react, that's your decision. Do they decide hygiene is overrated and embrace a life of filth, flatulence, and fun? Or do they cling desperately to any last semblance of cleanliness as it is slowly torn from their grip?

Anything you want is completely fine, as long as you follow a few ground rules:
No Weight Gain/Inflation. There are plenty of slob stories on this website, and I, for one, like the filth without the fat.
No death/gore
No vore

Have fun!
